triples.name: Reinforcement Learning
triples.relevance: The paper surveys the application of reinforcement learning, one of three core machine learning paradigms, in real-world robotic systems.

triples.name: Deep Reinforcement Learning
triples.relevance: The paper focuses specifically on deep reinforcement learning (DRL), which combines RL with deep neural networks for robotic applications.

triples.name: Deep Learning
triples.relevance: Deep learning is the foundational technique that enables deep RL to process unstructured input data without manual engineering.

triples.name: Robotics
triples.relevance: The paper examines the application domain of robotics, analyzing real-world robotic competencies and challenges.

triples.name: Robot Locomotion
triples.relevance: The paper evaluates DRL successes in robot locomotion, a key robotic competency discussed in the survey.

triples.name: Robot Navigation
triples.relevance: The paper covers navigation as one of the key robotic competencies where DRL has been successfully applied.

triples.name: Manipulator
triples.relevance: The paper evaluates DRL performance in robotic manipulation tasks, including both stationary and mobile manipulation.

triples.name: Mobile Manipulator
triples.relevance: The paper discusses mobile manipulation as a key robotic competency combining mobility with dexterous manipulation capabilities.

triples.name: Human-Robot Interaction
triples.relevance: The paper evaluates DRL successes in human-robot interaction, a critical competency for real-world robotic systems.
